summary: Kenneth S McHargh was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978, specifically in documents covering May, October, and November. These documents detail his position, annual salary, and pay period earnings within the committee. The consistent appearance of his name across these reports indicates his continued employment with the HSCA during the specified period.
significance: Kenneth S McHargh's significance lies in his employment within the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his exact role, his inclusion in payroll and certification reports suggests he was a staff member involved in the committee's operations during 1978.
